CatDescriptText: Richard Kennedy, 128 Wooster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1958, pg. 1 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "There is nothing wrong with the Pirates.  They have just been getting the bad breaks.  The team as a whole is all right.  I believe that Murtaugh is using the best players."
TitMainTitle: Richard Kennedy, wearing dark pinstriped suit and pocket scarf, standing in interior with light colored wall and triangular shaped pattern on right
